--- title: "Video Game Data Visualization" author: "math4mads" date: "2023-12-14" categories: [dataframe,visualization,julia] image: "image.jpg" --- :::{.callout-note title="简介"} ref :[Video games sales analysis and visualization](https://www.kaggle.com/code/snanilim/video-games-sales-analysis-and-visualization/notebook#notebook-container) ::: ## 1. load package ::: {#a434a9f7 .cell execution_count=1} ``` {.julia .cell-code} include("../utils.jl") # import load_csv method Random.seed!(34343) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=13} ``` TaskLocalRNG() ``` ::: ::: ## 2. dataprocessing ### 2.1 load data ::: {#59e5d60e .cell execution_count=2} ``` {.julia .cell-code} raw_data=load_csv("vgsales",false) @info "size"=>size(raw_data) first(raw_data,10) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` [ Info: "size" => (16598, 11) ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=14} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ### 2.2 features to lowercase ::: {#5ab3dc45 .cell execution_count=3} ``` {.julia .cell-code} #raw_features=names(raw_data) data=@pipe names(raw_data)|>lowercase.(_)|>rename(raw_data,_) first(data,1) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=15} ```{=html}
1×11 DataFrame
Rowranknameplatformyeargenrepublisherna_saleseu_salesjp_salesother_salesglobal_sales

11Wii SportsWii2006SportsNintendo41.4929.023.778.4682.74
``` ::: ::: ### 2.3 describe dataframe ::: {#b274111e .cell execution_count=4} ``` {.julia .cell-code} describe(data) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=16} ```{=html}
11×7 DataFrame

``` ::: ::: nmissing that is great! ### 2.4 data type Rank - Ranking of overall sales, integer Name - The games name Platform - Platform of the games release (i.e. PC,PS4, etc.), object Year - Year of the game's release, float Genre - Genre of the game ,object Publisher - Publisher of the game, object NA_Sales - Sales in North America (in millions), float EU_Sales - Sales in Europe (in millions), float JP_Sales - Sales in Japan (in millions), float Other_Sales - Sales in the rest of the world (in millions), float Global_Sales - Total worldwide sales, float ## 3. data analysis ### 3.1 What genre games have been made the most? that is to count every genre's game ::: {#efe102ae .cell execution_count=5} ``` {.julia .cell-code} df3_1=@pipe groupby(data,:genre)|>combine(_,nrow)|>rename(_,:nrow=>:counts)|>sort(_,:counts;rev=true) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=17} ```{=html}
12×2 DataFrame
Rowgenrecounts
String15Int64
1Action3316
2Sports2346
3Misc1739
4Role-Playing1488
5Shooter1310
6Adventure1286
7Racing1249
8Platform886
9Simulation867
10Fighting848
11Strategy681
12Puzzle582
``` ::: ::: ::: {#7d4d1e16 .cell execution_count=6} ``` {.julia .cell-code} function plot_df3_1(df::AbstractDataFrame) rows,_=size(df) featrues=names(df) fig=Figure(resolution=(500,600)) ax=Axis(fig[1,1],title="counts of game by genre") ax.yticks=(1:rows,df.genre) #ax.xticklabelrotation = pi/2 ax.xlabel="counts" ax.ylabel="genre" GLMakie.barplot!(ax,1:rows,df.counts;color = df.counts, strokecolor = :black, strokewidth = 1,direction=:x) GLMakie.hidedecorations!(ax,label = false, ticklabels = false, ticks = false) fig end plot_df3_1(df3_1) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=18} ![](index_files/figure-html/cell-7-output-1.png){} ::: ::: so **Action** and **Sports** made most ### 3.2 Which year had the most game release? ::: {#35e0e970 .cell execution_count=7} ``` {.julia .cell-code} df3_2=@pipe groupby(data,:year)|>combine(_,nrow)|>rename(_,:nrow=>:counts)|>sort(_,:counts;rev=true) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=19} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ::: {#2c71dc50 .cell execution_count=8} ``` {.julia .cell-code} function plot_df3_2(df::AbstractDataFrame,cat::String="year") @assert names(df)[2]=="counts" rows=nrow(df) fig=Figure(resolution=(500,800)) ax=Axis(fig[1,1],title="count game by year") ax.yticks=(1:rows,df[:,cat]) #ax.xticklabelrotation = pi/2 ax.xlabel="counts" ax.ylabel="$cat" GLMakie.barplot!(ax,1:rows,df.counts;color = df.counts, strokecolor = :black, strokewidth = 1,direction=:x) GLMakie.hidedecorations!(ax,label = false, ticklabels = false, ticks = false) fig end plot_df3_2(df3_2) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=20} ![](index_files/figure-html/cell-9-output-1.png){} ::: ::: ### 3.3 Top 5 years games release by genre ### 3.4 Which year had the highest sales worldwide? ::: {#f303e786 .cell execution_count=9} ``` {.julia .cell-code} df3_4=@pipe groupby(data,:year)|>@combine(_,:global_sales=sum(:global_sales))|>sort(_,:year;rev=true) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=21} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ::: {#e9dea190 .cell execution_count=10} ``` {.julia .cell-code} function plot_df3_4(df::AbstractDataFrame) rows=nrow(df) fig=Figure(resolution=(500,700)) ax=Axis(fig[1,1],title="video game global sales") ax.yticks=(1:rows,df[:,"year"]) #ax.xticklabelrotation = pi/2 ax.xlabel="sales" ax.ylabel="year" GLMakie.barplot!(ax,1:rows,df.global_sales;color = df.global_sales, strokecolor = :black, strokewidth = 1,direction=:x) GLMakie.hidedecorations!(ax,label = false, ticklabels = false, ticks = false) fig end plot_df3_4(df3_4) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=22} ![](index_files/figure-html/cell-11-output-1.png){} ::: ::: ### 3.5 Which genre game has been released the most in a single year? ::: {#4dca2cc4 .cell execution_count=11} ``` {.julia .cell-code} df3_5=let df=@pipe groupby(data,[:year,:genre])|>combine(_,nrow=>:counts)|>groupby(_,:year) res=mapreduce(x->(sort(x,:counts;rev=true)|>first|>copy),vcat, df)|>DataFrame end ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=23} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ::: {#0845568e .cell execution_count=12} ``` {.julia .cell-code} function plot_df3_5(df::AbstractDataFrame) #@assert names(df)[2]=="counts" rows=nrow(df) fig=Figure(resolution=(1000,900)) ax=Axis(fig[1,1],title="video game most release in single year") ax.yticks=(1:rows,df[:,"year"]) #ax.xticklabelrotation = pi/2 ax.xlabel="release" ax.ylabel="year" GLMakie.barplot!(ax,1:rows,df.counts;color = df.counts, strokecolor = :black, strokewidth = 1,direction=:x ) for (idx, row) in enumerate(eachrow(df)) counts,year,genre=row.counts,row.year,row.genre GLMakie.text!(ax,counts+2,idx; text="$genre-$year",align = (:left, :center),fontsize=8) end GLMakie.hidedecorations!(ax,label = false, ticklabels = false, ticks = false) fig end plot_df3_5(df3_5) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=24} ![](index_files/figure-html/cell-13-output-1.png){} ::: ::: ### 3.6 Which genre game has sold the most in a single year? ::: {#5155095e .cell execution_count=13} ``` {.julia .cell-code} df6=@pipe select(data,[:year,:genre,:global_sales])|>groupby(_,[:year,:genre])|>@combine(_ ,:sales= sum(:global_sales))|>groupby(_,:year)|>@combine(_,n1=first(:genre), n2=first(:sales)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` ┌ Warning: Using an un-quoted Symbol on the LHS is deprecated. Write :n1 = ... instead. └ @ DataFramesMeta ~/.julia/packages/DataFramesMeta/nI3Y1/src/parsing.jl:373 ┌ Warning: Using an un-quoted Symbol on the LHS is deprecated. Write :n2 = ... instead. └ @ DataFramesMeta ~/.julia/packages/DataFramesMeta/nI3Y1/src/parsing.jl:373 ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=25} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ::: {#ca9de062 .cell execution_count=17} ``` {.julia .cell-code} function plot_df3_8(df::AbstractDataFrame) #@assert names(df)[2]=="counts" rows=nrow(df) fig=Figure(resolution=(600,800)) ax=Axis(fig[1,1],title="video game sales by Platform") ax.yticks=(1:rows,df[:,"platform"]) #ax.xticklabelrotation = pi/2 ax.xlabel="sales" ax.ylabel="platform" GLMakie.barplot!(ax,1:rows,df.sales;color = df.sales, strokecolor = :black, strokewidth = 1,direction=:x, bar_labels=:y ) GLMakie.hidedecorations!(ax,label = false, ticklabels = false, ticks = false) fig end plot_df3_8(df3_8) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=29} ![](index_files/figure-html/cell-18-output-1.png){} ::: ::: ### 3.9 Which individual game have the highest sale price globally? ::: {#461ba6af .cell execution_count=18} ``` {.julia .cell-code} df3_9=@pipe sort(data,:global_sales;rev=true)|>select(_,["name","year","global_sales"])|>first(_,20) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=30} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ::: {#ba2154b9 .cell execution_count=19} ``` {.julia .cell-code} function plot_top20_game(df::AbstractDataFrame) #@assert names(df)[2]=="counts" rows=nrow(df) fig=Figure(resolution=(800,800)) ax=Axis(fig[1,1],title="global sales top 20") ax.yticks=(1:rows,df[:,"name"]) #ax.xticklabelrotation = pi/2 ax.xlabel="sales" ax.ylabel="name" GLMakie.barplot!(ax,1:rows,df.global_sales;color = df.global_sales, strokecolor = :black, strokewidth = 1,direction=:x) for (idx, row) in enumerate(eachrow(df)) name,year,sales=row.name,row.year,row.global_sales GLMakie.text!(ax,sales+2,idx; text="$year-$sales",align = (:left, :center),fontsize=8) end GLMakie.hidedecorations!(ax,label = false, ticklabels = false, ticks = false) fig end plot_top20_game(df3_9) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=31} ![](index_files/figure-html/cell-20-output-1.png){} ::: ::: ### 3.10 Sales compearison by genre ::: {#589f25ad .cell execution_count=20} ``` {.julia .cell-code} df3_10=@pipe select(data,[:genre,:na_sales,:eu_sales,:jp_sales,:other_sales])|>groupby(_,:genre)|>@combine(_,$AsTable = (na_sales = sum(:na_sales), eu_sales = sum(:eu_sales),jp_sales=sum(:jp_sales),other_sales=sum(:other_sales))) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=32} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ::: {#441d9374 .cell execution_count=21} ``` {.julia .cell-code} function plot_df3_10_heatmap(df::AbstractDataFrame) genre=df.genre data=@pipe select(df,Not(:genre)) row,col=size(data) ma=@pipe Matrix(data)|>round.(_,digits=1) fig=Figure(resolution=(1000,400)) ax=Axis(fig[1,1],title="video game sales heatmap") ax.yticks=(1:col,names(data)) ax.xticks=(1:row,genre) heatmap!(ax,ma) [GLMakie.text!(ax,i,j;text="$(ma[i,j])",align = (:center, :center),fontsize=12,color=:white) for i in 1:row,j in 1:col] fig end plot_df3_10_heatmap(df3_10) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=33} ![](index_files/figure-html/cell-22-output-1.png){} ::: ::: ::: {#5ba65bba .cell execution_count=22} ``` {.julia .cell-code} res10=@pipe df3_10|>select(_,Not(:genre))|>Matrix|>permutedims|>reshape(_,(48,1))|>_[:,1] cats=@pipe df3_10|>select(_,Not(:genre))|>names type_name=df3_10.genre grp=repeat(1:4, 12) grp_x=repeat(1:12,inner=4) colors = cgrad(:tab10) function plot_df3_10_bardodge() fig=Figure(resolution=(1000,600)) ax=Axis(fig[1,1],title="video game sales barplot dodge",xticklabelrotation = pi/8) ax.xticks=(1:12,type_name) GLMakie.barplot!(ax,grp_x,res10; dodge =grp,color=colors[grp],strokecolor = :black, strokewidth = 1,bar_labels = :y,label_rotation=1/2*pi) labels = ["$i" for i in cats] elements = [PolyElement(polycolor = colors[i]) for (i,c) in enumerate(cats)] Legend(fig[1,2], elements, labels, "sales region", orientation=:vertical, tellwidth = true, tellheight =false) fig end plot_df3_10_bardodge() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=34} ![](index_files/figure-html/cell-23-output-1.png){} ::: ::: ### 3.11 Sales compearison by platform ::: {#938d14d8 .cell execution_count=23} ``` {.julia .cell-code} df3_11=@pipe select(data,[:platform,:na_sales,:eu_sales,:jp_sales,:other_sales,:genre])|>groupby(_,:platform)|>@combine(_,$AsTable = (na_sales = sum(:na_sales), eu_sales = sum(:eu_sales),jp_sales=sum(:jp_sales),other_sales=sum(:other_sales))) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=35} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ::: {#dbdcc78d .cell execution_count=24} ``` {.julia .cell-code} let res11 = @pipe df3_11 |> select(_, Not(:platform)) |> Matrix |> permutedims |> reshape(_, (124, 1)) |> _[:, 1] cats = @pipe df3_11 |> select(_, Not(:platform)) |> names type_name = df3_11.platform grp = repeat(1:4, 31) grp_x = repeat(1:31, inner=4) colors = cgrad(:tab10) function plot_platform_dodge() fig = Figure(resolution=(1800, 600)) ax = Axis(fig[1, 1], title="video game sales by platform", xticklabelrotation=pi / 8) ax.xticks = (1:31, type_name) GLMakie.barplot!(ax, grp_x, res11; dodge=grp, color=colors[grp], strokecolor=:black, strokewidth=1, bar_labels=:y, label_rotation=1 / 2 * pi) labels = ["$i" for i in cats] elements = [PolyElement(polycolor=colors[i]) for (i, c) in enumerate(cats)] Legend(fig[1, 2], elements, labels, "sales region", orientation=:vertical, tellwidth=true, tellheight=false) fig end plot_platform_dodge() end ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=36} ![](index_files/figure-html/cell-25-output-1.png){} ::: ::: ### 3.12 Top 20 Publisher ::: {#0c648e2f .cell execution_count=25} ``` {.julia .cell-code} df3_12=@pipe groupby(data,[:publisher])|>combine(_,nrow)|>rename(_,:nrow=>:counts)|>sort(_,:counts;rev=true)|>first(_,20) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=37} ```{=html}

text="$(sales)",align = (:center, :center),fontsize=12) # end GLMakie.hidedecorations!(ax,label = false, ticklabels = false, ticks = false) fig end plot_sales_by_region(df3_16) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=46} ![](index_files/figure-html/cell-35-output-1.png){} ::: ::: ::: {#edf7f136 .cell execution_count=35} ``` {.julia .cell-code} function plot_sales_by_region_pie(df::AbstractDataFrame) colors = [:yellow,:red, :purple, :green] fig=Figure(resolution=(500,500)) ax=Axis(fig[1,1];title="video game sales by region",autolimitaspect = 1) GLMakie.pie!(ax, df.sales;color=colors,radius=4,inner_radius = 2, strokecolor = :white, strokewidth = 5) labels = ["$i" for i in df.region] elements = [PolyElement(polycolor = colors[i]) for (i,c) in enumerate(df.region)] Legend(fig[1,2], elements, labels, "sales region", orientation=:vertical, tellwidth = true, tellheight =false) GLMakie.hidedecorations!(ax,label = false) fig end plot_sales_by_region_pie(df3_16) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=47} ![](index_files/figure-html/cell-36-output-1.png){} ::: ::: ### 3.17 Sales Histogram ::: {#c9762e55 .cell execution_count=36} ``` {.julia .cell-code} f=log # transfromer function df3_18=@pipe select(data,[:na_sales,:eu_sales,:jp_sales,:other_sales,:global_sales]) # log_df3_18=@pipe @transform(df3_18,:na_sales=f.(:na_sales),:eu_sales=f.(:eu_sales),:jp_sales=f.(:jp_sales), # :other_sales=f.(:other_sales),:global_sales=f.(:global_sales) # )|>select(_,[:na_sales,:eu_sales,:jp_sales,:other_sales,:global_sales]) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=48} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ::: {#6075f0f1 .cell execution_count=37} ``` {.julia .cell-code} function plot_sales_hist(df::AbstractDataFrame) cats=names(df) fig=Figure(resolution=(600,600)) for (idx, col) in enumerate(eachcol(df)) local ax=Axis(fig[fldmod1(idx,2)...],title=cats[idx]) data=@pipe filter(x->x!=0,col)|>f.(_) GLMakie.hist!(ax,data, color = :blue, strokewidth = 1, strokecolor = :black,label=cats[idx],normalization =:pdf) density!(ax, data; color = (:green, 0.4), label = "density", strokewidth = 2,strokecolor=:red,npoints = 15) end fig end plot_sales_hist(df3_18) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=49} ![](index_files/figure-html/cell-38-output-1.png){} ::: ::: ## The End That is a exercises about julia dataframe opreation methods
